author: Hadlee Simons
title: Android Wear now works with iPhone
text:
Android Wear now works with iPhone Article By: Hadlee Simons Mon, 31 Aug 2015 6:11 PM Share Your Email A screenshot of a video, showing a watch powered by Android Wear. 
Google launched its Android Wear smartwatch platform early last year, and it's had a mildly successful reception from critics and consumers alike. 
But the biggest catch was arguably that it wasn't compatible with iPhones. 
Fortunately that's changed, as Google announced that Android Wear watches now work with your iPhone. 
"Android Wear for iOS is rolling out today. Just pair your iPhone (iPhone 5, 5c, 5s, 6, or 6 Plus running iOS 8.2+) with an Android Wear watch to bring simple and helpful information right to your wrist," the company said in a blog post . 
Google confirmed that Android Wear is now compatible with the LG Watch Urbane, but added that all future smartwatches (including devices from Huawei, Asus and Motorola) will support iOS. Related Articles
